channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What is Harris' stance on Israel? Plus, takeaways from Biden's Oval Office speech
item.description: President Biden talked about the decision to end his bid for reelection and his plan for the next six months of his presidency in an Oval Office address. And, Vice President Harris' stance on Israel.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden talked about the decision to end his bid for reelection and his plan for the next six months of his presidency in an Oval Office address. And, Vice President Harris' stance on Israel.

(Image credit: Erin Schaff)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Voters have a lot on their minds in the swing states of Michigan and Arizona
item.description: How have the twists and turns in the presidential campaign played out in swing states? We talk with reporters in Arizona and Michigan about what voters there are saying.
item.content:encoded: How have the twists and turns in the presidential campaign played out in swing states? We talk with reporters in Arizona and Michigan about what voters there are saying.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Biden explained why he step aside in a rare Oval Office address to the nation
item.description: President Biden spoke about how he plans to "finish the job for the American people," now that he won't have a second term to do that in. He ended his reelection bid Sunday and endorsed Kamala Harris.
item.content:encoded: President Biden spoke about how he plans to "finish the job for the American people," now that he won't have a second term to do that in. He ended his reelection bid Sunday and endorsed Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Harris looks to strike a careful balance on Israel's war in Gaza
item.description: The vice president can't afford to repel supporters of Israel, a key Democratic constituency, as she works to win back some voters alienated by President Biden's policy on the war.
item.content:encoded:
The vice president can't afford to repel supporters of Israel, a key Democratic constituency, as she works to win back some voters alienated by President Biden's policy on the war.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Cardboard beds have returned to the Olympics. What do they do?
item.description: Cardboard beds are one of the Olympics' latest green innovations. But not all the athletes are fans.
item.content:encoded:
Cardboard beds are one of the Olympics' latest green innovations. But not all the athletes are fans.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Rogue ACA insurance agents could face criminal charges under a proposed law
item.description: Consumers, without their consent, are being enrolled in Affordable Care Act plans or their coverage is switched. A powerful U.S. senator has introduced legislation to curb the growing problem.
item.content:encoded: Consumers, without their consent, are being enrolled in Affordable Care Act plans or their coverage is switched. A powerful U.S. senator has introduced legislation to curb the growing problem.
item.dc:creator: Julie Appleby

item.title: Will Harris sway PA voters? A Pittsburgh area Democrat and Republican each have a say
item.description: Pennsylvania is a swing state, site of the attempt on ex-President Trump's life, and home of a potential Democratic VP pick. We talk with activists in Pennsylvania about how it's all playing there.
item.content:encoded:
Pennsylvania is a swing state, site of the attempt on ex-President Trump's life, and home of a potential Democratic VP pick. We talk with activists in Pennsylvania about how it's all playing there.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Obed Manuel

item.title: 4 takeaways from President Biden’s Oval Office address
item.description: In his first public remarks after exiting the race for president, Biden focused on his goals for his final months in office and painted a picture of the legacy he hopes to leave behind.
item.content:encoded:
In his first public remarks after exiting the race for president, Biden focused on his goals for his final months in office and painted a picture of the legacy he hopes to leave behind.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: U.S. women's soccer coach says the team has 'moved past' losses, is ready for Paris
item.description: The U.S. has a new coach, a reimagined roster and a chance to bounce back after dismal performances at recent major tournaments. The women's team has won four Olympic gold medals, but none since 2012.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has a new coach, a reimagined roster and a chance to bounce back after dismal performances at recent major tournaments. The women's team has won four Olympic gold medals, but none since 2012.

(Image credit: Alex Livesey)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: California's newest state park is like a time machine
item.description: California's newest state park just opened this summer — and a visit is like stepping into a time machine as its creators reimagine what a state park can be.
item.content:encoded:
California's newest state park just opened this summer — and a visit is like stepping into a time machine as its creators reimagine what a state park can be.

(Image credit: Geloy Concepcion for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta
